item.name: Will of Sellarus
entries: The Will of Sellarus is a physical piece of paper that grants any demon great power. It is contained in an enchanted wooden box

entries.name: Appearance
entries: The will itself is a small (5 x 10 in) piece of paper with the Mark of Sellarus on it. When activated the mark glows red, and the paper bursts into scarlet flame that is absorbed by the demon
The 6 x 11 in box that contains the will is a dark wood and has the mark of Sellarus burnt into the top. The box has silver hinges at the back and the clasps at the front that hold a silver lock

Hebeshca thought the will could use more protection as well, and she convinced Sellarus to have a third key open the box, and to hide it somewhere. Sellarus agreed, and gave her the task of making the last key and gave King Wilber the task of hiding the box. Hebeshca made the Writ of Hebeshca and King Wilber put it in his vault, which Hebeshca enchanted.

entries.name: History
entries: In 1323, Sellarus realized if he didn’t put his power into an object, one of the many enemies he had collected over the years would get it from killing him. He decided to make a will, something that many powerful beings do for the same reason.

Initially, Sellarus was going to make the will only accessible by Kershak, but Hebeshca convinced him to give opportunity to Armentus and Cain by making the will able to be accessed by any demon. Sellarus agreed, and decided to make it a sort of game. He made the box in addition to the will so that it would be harder for his children to hold on to it, and per his request, Hebeshca made the box hard to detect magically.

entries.name: Properties
entries: The enchanted box can only be opened by the Keys of Sellarus, and harms any non-mortal that touches it, and by extension warlocks contacting their patron. The box shields detect magic spells from detecting the will inside of the box. The box also has powerful protection spells that shield it from harm.

item.name: Writ of Hebeshca
entries: The Writ of Hebeshca is a physical piece of paper that gives keys to the Monument of King Wilber and the last key of Sellarus

entries.name: Appearance
entries: The Writ is a 8.5 x 11 in. piece of paper that has writing in abysmal. When activated, it bursts into scarlet flames that shoot four large sparks.
The writing is: Only mortals may use this writ for only they can comprehend the weight of the missing. May this fuel their discovery.

entries.name: History
entries: When Sellarus made a will in 1323, Hebeshca wanted there to be more protection for it. Sellarus agreed and among other things the Writ of Hebeshca was made to require mortal involvement in getting access to the will. Hebeshca also helped convince Sellarus to make the Monument of King Wilber

Sellarus Hebeshca and Sellarus didn't tell their children about the Writ of Hebeshca. Instead, both Cain and Armentus found out from their acolyte's research of King Wilber. Kershak only found out when Serick asked for information from Elesira Ceydor

To make the will harder to access, Hebeshca put the writ in a small temple in what is Bardoran. When Bardoran took over the area, this temple was looted and the writ was unknowingly brought to the Bardoran castle

entries.name: Properties
entries: When ignited, the piece of paper burst into scarlet flames that shoots four large sparks at five nearby intelligent mortals before burning up completely, leaving no part of it behind.

Those who have been marked by the writ gain markings of keys on their forearm and the text: "key to the Monument of King Wilber". Once The Marked open the entrance to King Wilber’s vault, the key and text change, now saying: " Key to the Vault of King Wilber". Finally, when The Marked reach the vault, the markings go away all together, but a piece of the Last Key of Sellarus is embedded under the skin of their forearm
The Monument and Vault of King Wilber are magically connected to each other, and multiple things activate because of the location of the keys

The Last Key of Sellarus is split up as follows: the shaft and ring are each split in half, with one person having half of the shaft, another having the other half, another having half of the ring, and the last having the other half of the ring

item.name: Rameselt
entries: Rameselt is a dwarven spice initially used to flavor food but has been found to burn extremely hot and is hard to put out

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Rameselt is a fine powder, as coarse as salt. It can come in colors such as green, orange, red, and yellow.

entries.name: History
entries: Rameselt was created initially as a dye. When dissolved in water it can create vibrant colors that last. It is quite expensive to produce, and it was found to taste quite good. Its price and good taste made it a commodity for the nobles and rich of Bardoran. During the cooking process it was discovered that it can also be a form of fuel and Bardoran testing found it is a powerful weapon.

entries.name: Ignition
entries: When Rameselt is ignited with a flame, the minerals in it begin melting and it begins to spark at a rapid rate. This sends specks of molten metal flying in out of where the rameselt was ignited. As the rest of the rameselt catches, it pops and shoots out more sparks, and sometimes chunks of rameselt that begin reacting themselves.

item.name: Compass of Garletor
entries: Compass that can points to things hidden with magic, up to 50 ft away

entries.name: Appearance
entries: The Compass of Garletor looks very expensive. It is about 2.5 inches across, with a silver body with carvings of curvy flourishes. The glass on the top has a silver rim around it, and markings on the glass itself, inside of the compass the shiny blue metal needle comes to a point with a carving of an eye at the end. Inside of the compass the backing is a dark metal that has shiny blue flourishes. The top of the compass is comes to a small point to help the user orient themselves toward the hidden subject
The Markings on the glass are runes: The hidden is found more than the ordinary
When the compass senses something, the blue markings and needle glow.

entries.name: History
entries: The Compass of Garletor was created by the Wizard Garletor for King (Cabil) Furnit II for a raid of a hidden base of cultists using a drop of Hebeshca's blood

entries.name: Appearance
entries: The Crystal of Armentus usually just appears to be a hollow, 2 in diameter ball made of a ligh blue glass.
When activated, the Crystal of Armentus glows blue and appears to be filled with water that moves as if there is no gravity inside of the ball.

entries.name: History
entries: {@adventure Armentus|CRDA|5|Armentus} made the Crystal in 1580 to be able to have influence while staying hidden.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The scout has advantage on saving throws against poison.

Bardoran scouts wear light leather armor and carry only daggers and slings. Their main purpose is to lead a stronger force of soldiers to places to attack. They also get information about enemies and chase down enemies that escape battle. They carry a palm sized flare device that consists of a piece of wood wrapped in a cloth that has been coated in flammable liquid. The Scout can ignite the device and use their sling to throw it in the air so that other Bardoran military forces can see their position.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scout makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Signal
entries: The scout uses its sling to launch a flare into the air for other Bardoran soldier to see.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 30/120 ft., or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The enforcer has advantage on saving throws against poison.

Bardoran enforcers act as police officers in Bardoran. During the conquest they would imprison enemy civilians and force them out of the area or force them to work. They wear chainmail armor and carry a whip, shortsword, and shield. Their main function is crowd control of civilians. Today they are used to oversee the workers of the forges.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The enforcer makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4 + 0}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 0}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The conqueror has advantage on saving throws against poison.

Bardoran Conquerors are the main fear of other nations. They are heavily armored, carry large shields, spear, longswords, or crossbows. They are very hard to defeat and they are used for the initial attack of enemies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The conqueror makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8 + 0}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 0}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The berserker has advantage on saving throws against poison.

Bardoran Berserkers chaotic soldiers that cause as much damage as possible. They wear no armor, but powerful axes and hammers. They are fast moving and value destruction over their own life. They are willing to die if needed, so the day before a battle they are given royal treatment. In a battle, they run in first to break the enemy lines for the conquerors to take the rest over. They also will chase escaping enemies at the end of battles.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Light Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4 + 0}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 0}) slashing damage.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8 + 0}) slashing damage.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8 + 0}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

data.name: Cerdia World Info
entries: This adventure serves as a imformation storage system for the Cerdia Campaign

data.name: Nations and Groups
entries: Bardoran is a great northern empire of dwarfs.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Dwarves occupy Bardoran, but there are other groups that were not pushed out during the conquet. These other groups are either in hiding or being pressured by Bardoran.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Bardoran Is the main metal producer in the world. Trades/sells with metal to {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Dremin Warberset}. Bardoran doesn't actually do manufacturing of tools, but just sells metal in bars and plates that Mayland buys.

items: The king and the nobles are on the top of the class system in Bardoran. The nobles own grand forges and get most of the money from them. The nobles are like kings themselves, they can command the military as they wish. The nobles are also just the friends of the king.
Bardoran Soldiers are the middle teir of the class system. Scouts are the lowest rank, enforcers after, and conquerors and berserkers are of equal rank. All soldiers have athority over the workers.

The large majority of Bardoran citizens are workers. Most of those workers are employed by the grand forges where they work long and harsh hours for little pay. There is little other forms of employment in Bardoran, by design.

farmers of {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} are on the lowest rung of the social ladder in Bardoran. Warberland citizens are treated as poorly as workers, but also workers and nobles alike see them less than equal to dwarfs.

The main economy of Bardoran and the wealth of the governement is a result of the grand forges of Bardoran. Both mines and forges, these large factories collect and process metal to be sold to {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Mayland}. These forges are owned by the nobles of Bardoran.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Bardoran government is a monarchy. The nobles of Bardoran also have governing power but the king has the final say

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Barus Torid → {@adventure Dremin Warberset|CRDA|5|Dremin Warberset}

entries.name: Military
entries: The Bardoran military is extremely large and powerful. Its ground troops are feared, and it secretly began work on a powerful navy

entries.name: Bardoran Military Assets
entries: {@bold {@creature Bardoran Scout|CRDA}}

items: Bardoran scouts wear light leather armor and carry only daggers and slings Their main purpose is to lead a stronger force of soldiers to places to attack. They also get information about enemies and chase down enemies that escape battle.

Scouts carry a palm sized flare device that consists of a piece of wood wrapped in a cloth that has been coated in flammable liquid. The Scout can ignite the device and use their sling to throw it in the air so that other Bardoran military forces can see their position.

entries: {@bold {@creature Bardoran Enforcer|CRDA}}

items: Bardoran enforcers act as police officers in Bardoran. During the conquest they would imprison enemy civilians and force them out of the area or force them to work. They wear chainmail armor and carry a whip, shortsword, and shield.
Enforcers are used in Bardoran to oversee the forges by making sure the workers do their job.
Enforcers are used in {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} to collect taxed goods.

entries: {@bold {@creature Bardoran Conqueror|CRDA}}

items: Bardoran Conquerors are the main fear of other nations. They are heavily armored, carry large shields, spear, longswords, or crossbows. They are very hard to defeat and they are used in the initial attack of enemies settlements.

entries: {@bold {@creature Bardoran Berserker|CRDA}}

items: Bardoran Berserkers chaotic soldiers that cause as much damage as possible. They wear no armor, but powerful axes and hammers. They are fast moving and value destruction over their own life.
In a battle, berserkers run in first to break the enemy lines for the conquerors to take the rest over. They also will chase escaping enemies at the end of battles.
Berserkers are willing to die if needed, so the day before a battle they are given royal treatment.

entries: {@bold {@vehicle Warship|GoS| Bardoran Warships}}

items: Bardoran Warships are armored vehicles that transport soldiers to war. They don't carry any weapons on them. Instead, these ships ram into other ships so that Bardoran forces may board.

entries.name: Early Years (1442 - 1575)
items: The Small kingdom of Bardoran was founded by Barus Torid in 1442 CE. Similar to the kingdoms around, Bardoran was a small mining kingdom with little actual power or class system. At the time, there was only the miner middle class and the leading upper class where the miners would get resources and the leaders would manage and sell the resources. Bardoran sustained itself by selling raw minerals to nearby nations with processing infrastructure in exchange for food.

In 1545, Torid retired and gave his crown to {@adventure Dremin Warberset|CRDA|5|Dremin Warberset}, a close advisor. Previous to this, Warberset had helped to negotiate trade deals with the nearby nations where he would sell raw materials in exchange tools, or a cut of processed metal for use of their forges. These greatly increased the quality of life for Bardoran miners, as well as their efficiency. This along with Warberset’s vision of a united dwarven kingdom made Torid feel Warberset would be a good king.

entries.name: The Conquest (1575 - 1608)
items: Over time, the citizens of Bardoran and Warberset himself began to become frustrated with nearby nations encroaching and forming trade agreements without Bardoran. {@adventure Kershak|CRDA|5|Kershak} took advantage of this frustration and made a deal with Warberset. With Kershak’s help, Bardoran easily took over its previously equally matched neighboring nations. Bardoran used the claimed resources to grow a powerful military force and {@adventure conquered the north|CRDA|3|The Conquest of the North}.
Bardoran stopped expanding with the capturing of {@adventure Artoz|CRDA|1|Artoz} in 1608 C.E. after which the colony {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} was made in its place.

entries.name: Post Conquest (1608 - Present)
items: Bardoran did not sustain a military presence in Warberland, but instead only sent troops as needed. Because of this, Warberland is not considered a part of Bardoran, but rather an asset.

Once Bardoran had established control over the north, it began selling metal to {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Mayland} to sustain an economy, something that the nearby nations used to do befor the conquest.
{@adventure The Conquest of The North |CRDA|3|The Conquest of The North}

entries.name: Warberland
entries: Warberland is an opressed colony of Bardoran.

entries.name: Warberland has no flag
entries: The {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} flag is hung in many places in Waberland

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Many different races occupy Warberland. Originally occupied by humans, Halflings, Satyr, and similar creatures. During the conquest of the north, {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} pushed many other races like Kobalts and dragonborns down into the south into current day Warberland.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Warberland has little economic prosperity. There are many farms in Warberland but {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} taxes them by taking their crops, so the area is in constant poverty.

items: Due to {@adventure Bardoran's|CRDA|1|Bardoran} control over the area, Waberland farmers are heavily taxed. These taxes require the farmers to give most of their yield to Bardoran. Depending on the specific product, {{@creature Bardoran Enforcer|CRDA|Bardoran enforcers}} will arrive at different farms in Warberland with large wagons and the farmers will be forced to fill the wagons with their product.

Failure to comply with the tax laws or to meet production standards result in the land being taken by Bardoran and the current owners will be imprisoned. The land is then sold to another farmer, or multiple farmers.

The king and the nobles are on the top of the class system in Bardoran. The nobles own grand forges and get most of the money from them. The nobles are like kings themselves, they can command the military as they wish. The nobles are also just the friends of the king.
Bardoran Soldiers are the middle teir of the class system. Scouts are the lowest rank, enforcers after, and conquerors and berserkers are of equal rank. All soldiers have athority over the workers.

The large majority of Bardoran citizens are workers. Most of those workers are employed by the grand forges where they work long and harsh hours for little pay. There is little other forms of employment in Bardoran, by design.

farmers of Warberland are on the lowest rung of the social ladder in Bardoran. Warberland citizens are treated as poorly as workers, but also workers and nobles alike see them less than equal to dwarfs.

entries.name: Government
entries: Warberland doesn't have its own government, but is overseen by {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran}. Being mainly a nation of independent farmers under the constant threat of Bardoran, the citizens of Warberland don't form large groups. Laws are determined by Bardoran as well.

entries.name: Military
entries: Warberland has no military of it's own. Warberland is not a very valuable area for most nations in the first place, but it also has been claimed by {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} which other nations don't want to fight. Bardoran keeps some {@creature Bardoran Enforcer|CRDA| enforcers} and  {@creature Bardoran Scout|CRDA| scouts} Warberland to hold control over the farmers, and to report the activities of nearby nations.

items: Bardoran Warships are armored vehicles that transport soldiers to war. They don't carry any weapons on them. Instead, these ships ram into other ships so that Bardoran forces may board.

entries.name: Founding (1608)
items: The land occupied by Warberland was once the nation {@adventure Artoz|CRDA|1|Artoz}. In 1608 CE Artoz attempted to fight {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} to avoid it becoming too powerful, but it was already too late, and Atroz to crushed by the Bardoran Military. Bardoran named the area Warberland after the Bardoran king, {@adventure Dremin Warberset|CRDA|5|Dremin Warberset}.
Bardoran did not sustain a military presence in Warberland, but instead only sent troops as needed. Because of this, Warberland is not considered a part of Bardoran, but rather an asset.

entries.name: Colonization (1608 - Present)
items: Due to the large amount of farms in Warberland already before it took over, Bardoran decided to use it's new found land to produce food with nothing in return.
{@adventure The Conquest of The North |CRDA|1|The Conquest of The North}

entries.name: Artoz
entries: Artoz was a nation where Warberland currently is that tried to attack Bardoran.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Artoz had races like saytrs, humans, and halfling.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Artoz was always a somewhat poor farming nation, They would trade crops with nations in current day {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} in exchange for metal tools and weapons. Near the end of it's existance Artoz began selling property.

entries.name: Government
entries: Artoz had a representative government where each representative would be allocated for a certain area based on population.

entries.name: Military
entries: Knowing that the farmer population would not stand a chance against conflict, Artoz formed a strong military out of fear being attacked by other groups. This military consisted of well trained farmers given weapons that had been bought using crops and the sale of property.

Once Artoz attacked {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran}, this military was destroyed. Some of the soldiers joined {@adventure The Resistance of Artoz|CRDA|1|Resistance of Artoz} to continue fighting against Bardoran.

entries.name: Founding (1372)
items: Before Artoz was formed, there were many farmers around the area it's capital occupied. As the farms began to grow, they decided to form a small local government. Other farmers did the same, and these smaller governments began to combine into one larger, representative government. This government was named Artoz in 1372, and they built a capital building in what is now the {@adventure capital of Warberland|CRDA|2|capital of Warberland}.

entries.name: Attacking Bardoran (1608)
items: In 1608, when the conquest had been occurring for 33 years, the citizens of Artoz began to worry {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} would expand south, into Artoz. At this time Bardoran began to build large ships to transport goods around what is now the {@adventure Bardoran River|CRDA|2|Bardoran River}. The presence of Bardoran ships made Artoz more nervous. Hoping to prevent Bardoran from expanding south, Artoz attacked Bardoran.

Artoz attempted to attack Garthora believing that most of the army was east. While this was true, most of Bardoran military was just returning, and Artoz was easily crushed. To make an example out of Artoz, Bardoran followed the retreating Artoz military back across the river and into Artoz.

Bardoran didn't go that far into Artoz, and quickly pulled most of its troops back into the north. Instead of making Artoz a part of Bardoran, Artoz became a colony named {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} after the king of Bardoran, {@adventure Dremin Warberset|CRDA|5|Dremin Warberset}. Most citizens of Artoz didn't come into contact with Bardoran until {@creature Bardoran Enforcer|CRDA|bardoran enforcers} began taxing them.
When Artoz was made into Warberland the remaining members of the Artoz military formed a secret group called {@adventure The Resistance of Artoz|CRDA|2|Resistance of Artoz}.
{@adventure The Conquest of The North |CRDA|3|The Conquest of The North}

entries.name: Resistance of Artoz
entries: The Resistance of Artoz is a communication network of anti-Bardoran rebels.

entries.title: Flag of the Resistance of Artoz

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Resistance of Artoz used to consist of those who were alive when {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} took over. As time went on however, the population shifted to mainly those who were born in Bardoran's colony. This population is even more diverse now that more people have moved into Warberland. The Resistance of Artoz has about 1000 members.

items: Members of the Resistance of Artoz use the chant "Long Live Artoz!" when executing a plan as both a tradition and to let others know the resistance is responsible for said plan.

The Resistance is very exclusive about who may join. People who want to can't actually apply anywhere, instead a member has to notice them. They will only be asked about joining if ten other members agree that they would be a good member, based on their passion, skill, and loyalty. This process involves a lot of spying.

A candidate who is picked will receive a message in some discreet way telling them they will be able to join the Resistance of Artoz if they complete some task. This task is often small but harmful to {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran}. If this task is completed to the satisfaction of the ten members, a member of the Resistance of Artoz will meet up with them secretly.

On rare occasions someone who is not interested in joining will be noticed by a member. In this case, as many as thirty members have to agree to allow one member to make contact, since doing so is a risk.
It is common for the kin of a member to eventually join the Resistance of Artoz, but the rules of the resistance dictate the child cannot know of their parent's involvement unless they are selected.

entries.name: Economy
entries: The Resistance of Artoz is funded in many different ways. All of these ways are hidden from {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran}. The members of the Resistance of Artoz themselves all have a very diverse set of occupations.

entries.name: Methods of Funding
entries: Selling crops behind {@adventure Bardoran's|CRDA|1|Bardoran} back
Doing black market jobs like smuggling
Stealing from the wealthy (Especially Bardoran)

entries.name: Government
entries: The Resistance of Artoz does not have a formal leadership, or even members in general. Instead, the Resistance of Artoz acts more like a messaging system between its members that alerts each other of upcoming plans or events.

When a member of the resistance of Artoz has a plan, They will send a message through the network asking if anyone would like to join or supply it. Likewise, if information is gained, a member can use the network to share this info.
There is a bit of a hierarchy inside of the Resistance of Artoz. When a particularly risky or important plan is made, some members will only share it between a few others to avoid the plan leaking.

items: The reason {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} has such a hard time controlling the Resistance of Artoz is because of its lack of structure. There is not one easily identifiable leader they can point to, and the Resistance of Artoz has no base of operations.

Bardoran has attempted to infiltrate the Resistance of Artoz multiple times, but has failed. Bardoran doesn't fully understand the process at which a member is chosen, and Artoz members can easily spot a Bardoran plant

entries.name: Military
entries: The Resistance of Artoz does not mainly consist of fighters. There are a good portion that are apt fighters, but most have skills that lie in deception and plotting.

entries.name: Founding (1608)
items: In 1608, the nation of Artoz attacked {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} in an attempt to stop its {@adventure growth|CRDA|3|The Conquest of the North}. This attack failed, and Artoz was made into the colony {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland}. The remaining members of the Artoz military split up for the sake of secrecy, but agreed to continue to discreetly communicate. They began calling themselves the Resistance of Artoz.

entries.name: Growth (1608 - Present)
items: As time continued, the Resistance of Artoz began to grow as the founders met with witty haters of Bardoran who too wished to restore Artoz to its former glory. At this time the process for adding members was created to preserve the secrecy of the Resistance operations. At the same time, the Resistance of Artoz was very open about when they carried out a large plan so that others would see that Bardoran could be harmed.
{@adventure The Conquest of The North |CRDA|3|The Conquest of The North}

entries.name: Freaxir
entries: Freaxir is the Wizard school Omurice attended.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Freaxir has similar demographics to {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} with some outliers. This includes dragonborns, humans, halflings, satyrs, tieflings, and kobalts.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Freaxir is quite wealthy. Many of the professors sell spell scrolls and magical items to get money for the university. Since the area is quite poor, the professors may rent out magical items or allow those who buy something to pay it off over time. These spells and items are usually just convenient rather than deadly, but they can still be powerful.

entries.name: Government
entries: {@adventure Headmistress Ceydor|CRDA|5|Elesira Ceydor} makes all the decisions at Freaxir but {@adventure Armentus|CRDA|5|Armentus} has the final say. Ceydor does often consult the professors of Freaxir before making a decision, and passes their input along to Armentus.

items: Professors in Freaxir are aware of {@adventure Armentus's|CRDA|5|Armentus} control of the school but don't often speak about it because of the connotations of a demon's school. Only Headmistress Elesira Ceydor makes direct contact with Armentus.

entries.name: Military
entries: Freaxir has little physical defense, but is rich in protection spells and skilled magic users if needed. So far there have been no conflicts where a military was required for Freaxir.

entries.name: Forming Freaxir (1320 - 1340)
items: Wanting to have skilled followers, {@adventure Armentus|CRDA|5|Armentus} decided to make a wizardry school. Armentus made contact with {@adventure Elesira Ceydor|CRDA|5|Elesira Ceydor} who also valued knowledge and wanted to make a positive difference in the world. They named this school Freaxir.

Ceydor first went in search of others who would be interested in creating such a school, and locations to build the school. After collecting 50 other talented magic users, they went to what is now the {@adventure capital of Warberland|CRDA|2|Capital of Warberland}. At the time, this was a small farming town and the developing nation of {@adventure Artoz|CRDA|1|Artoz}.

entries.name: Building Freaxir (1340-1351)
items: To actually build Freaxir, the magic users sold spell scrolls and magical items, and enchantments. With this money, Freaxir bought materials from what is now Bardoran, and a huge amount of labor from the surrounding area. The citizens of the area liked the sudden burst of wealth and opportunities, and creating Freaxir was one of the first forms of funding for the creation of Artoz. In 1351 the school was finished, but classes began being held in 1341 when some classrooms were finished.
Armentus purposefully made Freaxir confusing to navigate with hopes that students would explore it and to protect against some sort of attack.

entries.name: Growth (1341 - Present)
items: Initially the students of Freaxir were very limited but the project of building Freaxir was advertisement enough to make aspiring wizards in what is now {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} flock to Freaxir. The School was a huge success, and as more students left Freaxir skilled, more people wanted to go.

As Freaxir grew, so did its library. A pursuer of all knowledge, Ceydor set up an effective program to buy books from anyone who successfully bargained with the librarian. This gave Freaxir the opportunity to have a very diverse library with some texts that would otherwise never be read.

entries.name: The Armentus-Kershak Deal (1580)
items: When {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} began conquering the north, students, Professors, and Armentus alike became concerned for Freaxir's safety. Armentus made a deal with {@adventure Kerhsak|CRDA|5|Kershak} that in the Kershak took over the surrounding area, Freaxir would remain safe and able to operate.
{@adventure The Conquest of The North |CRDA|3|The Conquest of The North}

entries.name: Tarehas
entries: Tarehas is a smmall island kingdom that Aurelis Aerwyna is from.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Tarehas is occupied by mainly Humans but there are some human-like races like Halflings, Orcs. There is not a very dense population.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Tarehas generally keeps to itself andsustains itself from fishing and logging to build boats. Metal tools are bought from {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Mayland}.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Tarehas government is a monarchy. The somewhat small island nation managed to maintain a king who makes all laws because of its size and the traditional hearing hours

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Percy Aerwyna → Ben Aerwyna → Percival Aerwyna → George Aerwyna → Daniel Aerwyna. Currently prince {@adventure Alric Aerwyna|CRDA|1|Alric Aerwyna} is next in line.

entries.name: Traditonal Hearing Hours
entries: When he began ruling, Percy Aerwyna wanted to avoid becoming distant from the problems of his citizens, so he began the tradition of the "traditional hearing hours" and put them into the constitution of Tarehas. This policy says the king must set out seven hours once a week to allow his citizens to tell him their challenges and suggestions. These hearing hours are strictly open to all citizens of Tarehas, they just have to sign up beforehand. The king can take a break in between hearings to ponder and make decisions.

entries.name: Military
entries: Before the attacks of {@adventure Selatis|CRDA|1|Selatis}, the Tarehas military was a moderate size. It was enough to fend pirates off, and that is generally what was needed. Because of the the navy was the most funded part of the military.
Currently, the Tarehas military is a small resistance of both soldiers and civilians alike who are trying to retain control of Tarehas

entries.name: Founding (1565)
items: Before Tarehas was formed, some groups moved to the island to look for resource opportunities, but there weren't any unique or especially abundant ones. When the groups moved there, they began forming small communities independent of each other. Percy Aerwyna moved there when he was 32 also looking for opportunities, but ended up just settling there. He began communicating between the different communities and suggested they form an official kingdom. The other communities agreed and Tarehas was formed, and they made Aerwyna their king

entries.name: Growth (1565 - 1679)
items: Over time, the population of Tarehas grew from both immigrants and new generations. For many immigrants, Tarehas was seen as a calmer, isolated life that was quite attractive to some. Tarehas was easily able to sustain itself through fishing, foraging, and logging, so began to flourish.

entries.name: Conflict with Selatis (1679 - Present)
items: {@adventure Tensions |CRDA|3|The Selatis-Tarehas Conflict} grew between Tarehas and {@adventure Selatis|CRDA|1|Selatis} in 1679 over fishing territory disputes. Treaties that attempted to fix this issue were then ignored, and tensions grew further when Selatis captured a Tarehas boat that was disobeying the agreements. Tarehas then began doing the same until 12 boats of the Selatis navy arrived at Tarehas to negotiate.

During negotiations, one of the Selatis boats was lit on fire, and despite Tarehas claiming it was an independent citizen, Selatis declared war. At that point many more naval ships arrived at Tarehas, and began attacking.

After Selatis was successful in defeating the much smaller Tarehas navy, and was able to take control of the palace, it was stopped by the remaining soldiers and citizens of Tarehas. This began a stalemate between the Selatis soldiers occupying the Tarehas castle and the remaining Tarehas resistance hiding on the island.

entries.name: Selatis
entries: Selatis is a large fishing kingdom that fought with Selatis.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Selatis is very diverse. It was originally mostly human, but more races have mingled with the rest.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Selatis uses fishing and farming crops to sustain itself. It also sells wood and ships to {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Mayland}.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Selatis government is a monarchy, with a council of 30 lords. Both the king and the council of lords need to agree on a law to pass it, and either can introduce one.

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Michael Wilber → Gordon Wilber → Tyler Wilber → Samuel Cartage → William Cartage → Morgan Darius → Thomas Darius

entries.name: Military
entries: Selatis has moderate military strength. It has a large naval fleet and many guards, but the military tends to stay around the wealthy/noble areas.

entries.name: Founding (1318)
items: The land that Selatis occupies was once many informal nations. {@adventure Michael Wilber|CRDA|5|Michael Wilber} united some of the nations in opposition to a hostile nation and formed Selatis after the war, and was made king afterwards.

entries.name: Growth (1318 - 1679)
items: Over time Selatis acquired more land through both small wars and treaties. Throughout its history the population of Selatis grew both because of its growing territory and from immigrants. During {@adventure the conquest of the north|CRDA|3|The Conquest of the North}, many refugees entered Selatis for work and safety.

entries.name: Conflict with Tarehas (1679 - Present)
items: {@adventure Tensions |CRDA|3|The Selatis-Tarehas Conflict} grew between Selatis and {@adventure Tarehas|CRDA|1|Tarehas} in 1679 over fishing territory disputes. Treaties that attempted to fix this issue were then ignored, and tensions grew further when Selatis captured a Tarehas boat that was disobeying the agreements. Tarehas then began doing the same until 12 boats of the Selatis navy arrived at Tarehas to negotiate.
During negotiations, Selatis secretly set one of its own ships on fire to blame Tarehas and declare war.

After Selatis was successful in defeating the much smaller Tarehas navy, and was able to take control of the palace, it was stopped by the remaining soldiers and citizens of Tarehas. This began a stalemate between the Selatis soldiers occupying the Tarehas castle and the remaining Tarehas resistance hiding on the island.

In June every year Selatis hosts a week long festival in its capital city of {@adventure Tellensa|CRDA|2|Tellensa} to celebrate its founding. Many people, both rich and poor, travel to this festival. This festival involves all sorts of performances and sale of merchandise from both Selatis and travelers hoping to profit off of the immense amount of people.

entries.name: Mayland
entries: Mayland is a industry nation that trades with many others.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Mayland is very diverse. It has both many residents and travelers moving through it.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Mayland is very wealthy from its manufacturing and transportation businesses. Mayland doesn't produce any raw materials, instead it buys them and sells completed products back or to other nations.

items: Mayland buys metal from {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} and sells it to other nations. In addition Mayland sells metal tools back to Bardoran. Bardoran also buys ships from Mayland.
Mayland buys wood and ships from {@adventure Selatis|CRDA|1|Selatis}. At times, Mayland will build ships for Selatis using the wood from Selatis
Mayland buys livestock products from {@adventure Gartana|CRDA|1|Gartana}.

entries.name: Government
entries: Mayland does not have an official government, the area is more of a union of many powerful companies. The higher ups of these companies make decisions with each other, so there is sort of a council, but laws are generally decided by the individual companies.

entries.name: Military
entries: There is no formal Mayland military, but individual companies often hire guards for protection of their goods. These gaurds usually protect the company’s property (land, valuables), the estates of the company owners, or are used to enforce on the factory floor. There is little protection for the lower class, so violence is somewhat common in the slums of the lower class.

entries.name: Founding (1429)
items: Mayland was created when many companies in the area agreed to form a union. Over time, different companies had started to independently form along the River Zurn, and the company heads decided to form a name for the area

entries.name: Gartana
entries: Gartana is a strong military nation.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Gartana population is very diverse.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Gartana has both a livestock industry and a weapon manufacturing industry. Gartana sells livestock products to {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Mayland} and buys metal to make into weapons. Gartana also does some logging, but uses those resources for settlements and warships. Gartana buys crops from {@adventure Kortain|CRDA|1|Kortain}.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Gartana government consists of a king and representatives from different areas of Gartana.

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Evan Marris → Pladis Marris → Gregory Furnit → Cabil Furnit → Gregory (II) Furnit → Dawsor Clumond → Tershar Artus

entries.name: Military
entries: Gartana has great pride of it’s military. Being a union formed from wanting defence, Gartana has put many resources into its military. The Gartana military has both great equipment and numbers of soldiers. They often flaunt their military, through both army and naval parades. Each district has their own military that ultimately can be controlled by the king, but are meant to handle affairs locally.

items: Gartana has great values of strength because of its past. From a young age citizens of Gartana are taught to respect and honor the military. Joining the military is a common path for many young people.

entries.name: Founding (1488)
items: Gartana was formed originally as a union military of smaller nations who wanted security. There were generally many land disputes at the time, and many pirates that took advantage of the weak and small nations. After the Great Lemis War, Gartana formed an official kingdom.

entries.name: Kortain
entries: Kortain is a farming nation that is growing in wealth and population.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Kortain has a very diverse population.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Kortain sells crops to  {@adventure Gartana|CRDA|1|Gartana} and {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Mayland} and participates in slave trades with {@adventure Thrun|CRDA|1|Thrun}. Kortain also has a very large real estate market for wealthy entrepreneurs to begin industry. Kortain, being a somewhat newer kingdom, is trying to grow it’s economic influence.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Kortain government consists of a king and representatives from different areas of Kortain

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Totartec Brus → Preesha Hasheguel → Weltor Kalbos

entries.name: Military
entries: The Kortain Military is relatively strong, but it mainly is for defense. As a result the military tends to stay around heavily populated, especially wealthy, areas

entries.name: Founding ()
items: Kortain was founded by one of the clans that participated in the Great Lemis War. Overtime as other clans fell, they took up the land. None of Kortain has been taken as a result of force by Kortain, but Kortain scavanges destroyed kingdoms or suffering territories and offers them to join.

entries.name: Disciples of Vernacis
entries: The Disciples of Vernacis are a devoted followers of Vernacis

entries.name: The Disciples of Vernacis have no flag
Occupants
entries: The Disciples of Vernacis consits of about 50 orcs

entries.name: Economy
entries: The Disciples of Vernacis sustain themselfs through hunting and gathering in the Forlorn Mountains. Over it's existance they have become very good at hunting animals like bighorn sheep, coyotes, and snakes for both food and resources. As a result most of the weapons of the Disciples of Vernacis are made from stone and bone, and their clothes made of animal skin.

entries.name: Government
entries: All of the decisions of the Disciples of Vernacis are made by {@adventure  Vernacis|CRDA|5|Vernacis}.

entries.name: Military
entries: The Disciples of Vernacis have a good portion skilled warriors.

entries.name: Founding (1319)
items: In 1319 a division grew between the orc clan {@adventure  Vernacis|CRDA|5|Vernacis} was a part of. Many orcs began leaving in search of better opportunities. On some occasions these orcs would return and tell the others of the growing world outside of the Forlorn Mountains. This caused a division between those in the clan who wanted to stay in the mountains and those who wanted the clan to go out of the mountains.

Vernacis was a part of the side that wanted to stay. His bad experiences had tainted the rest of Cerdia for him, and he argued against leaving the familiar Forlorn Mountains despite what better lives may be outside of them. Vernacis became a leader of those who wanted to stay. Eventually the clan split, and Vernacis was made leader of the new clan. This was the beginning of the Disciples of Vernacis.

entries.name: Thrun
entries: Thrun is a small but wealthy desert nation.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Thrun is very diverse.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Thrun has many different economic opperations. It has a slave trade with {@adventure Kortain|CRDA|1|Kortain}, and sells exotic crops to {@adventure Mayland|CRDA|1|Mayland}. Thrun has sells real-estate to entrepreneurs.

items: Thrun has a very wide wealth gap. There are many people who hope to gain wealth from the growing area, but few actually do. Those who are already wealthy have gained more wealth from the area. On the other hand, Thrun’s economy is based on the work of slaves.

Thrun has a powerful bank that many of the rich citizens of Thrun have shares of. This bank handles loans for real-estate and other projects. Because of the growing population and economic experiments, this bank is very rich.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Thrun government is a council of the wealthiest citizens of Thrun

entries.name: Military
entries: Thrun has a small but well armed military. The Thrun military is used only to defend the property of the wealthy. The wealthy also tends to hire their own personal guards.

entries.name: Founding (1649)
items: Thrun was founded by a group of four powerful gangs in 1649. The desert is a lawless and environmentally harsh area with no real ruler. Thrun was founded to establish a permanent area of power. The Four gangs joined forces to combat other gangs and groups of gangs, and set up permanent settlements at the tip of the dry mountains. The gangs were quite wealthy, and quickly were able to buy supplies and slaves to begin building their kingdom. Entrepreneurs joined to grow their wealth in the growing Kingdom.

entries.name: Thurik Krouw
entries: The Thurik Krouw is an anti-Thrun resistance.

entries.name: The Thurik Krouw has no flag
Occupants
entries: The Thurik Krouw is very diverse.

entries.name: Economy
entries: The Thurik Krouw gets its money (and often supplies) by stealing it from the wealthy

entries.name: Government
entries: The Thurik Krouw have a group of ten people that make up the leaders. These leaders are the most experienced and skilled members. These leaders will plan missions and can appoint other members to a leadership role in the missions.

entries.name: Military
entries: The Thurik Krouw is a very skilled military force as it consists of skilled fighters. Their main restriction is their lack of supplies compared to {@adventure Thrun|CRDA|1|Thrun}.

entries.name: Founding (1678)
items: In 1678 a group of escaped slaves formed the Thurik Krouw to help other slaves escape and fight {@adventure Thrun|CRDA|1|Thrun}.

entries.name: Elestir
entries: Elestir is the hidden nation of elves.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Elestir consists of elfs with a somewhat small population, about 35000.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Elestir sustains itself through farming and foraging

entries.name: Government
entries: Elestir has a council of 10 leaders who make the decisions. Sometimes they will ask for the opinion of Atheria, or be commanded by her.

entries.name: Military
entries: There once was a much greater military of Elestir, but the population in general has decreased. There are only about 5000 in the official Elestir military, but most of the population are apt fighters.

entries.name: Founding (BCE)
items: Atheria created the elfs as her mortal followers BCE, and many remained in the Forest Drisk, forming Elestir.

entries.name: Verathon
entries: Verathon is the hidden nation of drow.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Verathon consists of a relatively small population of drow, about 10000.

entries.name: Verathon Community Ideals
entries: The Drow are held together by a strong sense of community. Honor is seen as acting for the ones you love. Freiseln set up these ideals to contrast her mother, who she sees as self absorbed.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Verathon sustains itself through foraging and farming.

entries.name: Government
entries: Verathon is a Matriarchy where Freiseln makes the final decision, but she communicates greatly with her followers and allows anyone to seek her presence.

entries.name: Military
entries: There ae many apt fighters in Verathon, but not a formal military. One is not needed for such an isolated nation. If need be, the more able Drow will take up arms in honor of Verathon.

entries.name: Founding (BCE)
items: The some elfs split off from the Elestir in allegiance to Freiseln who left her mother, Atheria. They asked Freiseln to make their skin the same dark purple as hers as a sign of allegiance. Thus the drow were born, and they retreated to the dark caves under the Forest Drisk. BCE

entries.name: The Verathon Ceremony
entries: Every year the Drow have a ceremony on the day that they succeeded from Elestir. At first this ceremony was to commemorate this day, but over time it has become less about Elestir, and more about the formation of Verathon in general. In the ceremony, those coming of age take a rounded knife called a fear-cleaver and cut a nonlethal wound on a part of their body they choose to demonstrate they are ready to give to the community. Frieseln then wraps the wound with webs. The cut leaves a scar that the drow often look at to remind themselves of their community.

entries.name: Craiton
entries: Craiton was a small military town that was destroyed by drow

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Cration is mostly human.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Craiton is rather small and sustains itself on farming

entries.name: Government
entries: Craiton is a small monarchy where the lord would make decrees.

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Jeremiah Crait → David Crait → Simon Crait

entries.name: Military
entries: {@i No Info}

entries.name: Founding ()
items: Jeremiah Crait founded the small village with the goal of being a heavily defended haven from bandits

entries.name: Garthora
entries: Garthora is the capital of Bardoran.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Garthora is occupied by dwarfs. The population is mainly {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} soldiers.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: Garthora is in dark, rocky mountains with volcanic activity. A combination of this volcanic activity and the forges in the area mean there is always a dark cloud of smog resting over the mountains.

Most of Garthora is inside of the mountains protected by a grand stone wall protruding from the cliff face. Inside of the city, there are no individual buildings but rather rooms carved out of the dark stone. This layout includes may wide and long halls forming a tunnel system.
Garthora has walls of dark stone bricks with intricate dwarven carvings. Its halls have large, carved pillars and rounded roofs. Garthora is lit by fires burning in pockets in the walls.

entries.name: Founding (1441)
items: Barus Torrid founded Garthora as the capital of {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} in 1441.
{@adventure The Conquest of The North |CRDA|3|The Conquest of The North}

entries: The Warberset Grand Forge is the forge owned by Dremin Warberset.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Warberset is occupied by dwarfs. The population is mainly workers but still has many {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} soldiers.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries: Dran's Deep is a Bardoran Prison that keeps Merazarx.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Dran's Deep is very diverse. There are many {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} soldiers as well.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Warberset Mountains
entries: The Warberset Mountains are a volcanic mountain range in Bardoran.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Warbset Mountains are mainly dwarves but there are some outliers in fire/volcanic or mountain/cave retated groups there.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries: The Burning mountains are a volcanic mountain range in Bardoran

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Burning Mountains are mainly dwarves but there are some outliers in fire/volcanic or mountain/cave retated groups there.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Trask Mountains
entries: The Trask mountains are a mountain range in Bardoran.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Trask Mountains are mainly dwarves but there are some outliers in fire/volcanic or mountain/cave retated groups there.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: The Bardoran River is a wide river south of Bardoran.
entries: ENTER SUBTITLE

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Trask Bardoran River has mainly dwarves around it but there are some outliers in fire/volcanic or mountain/cave retated groups there. Likewise, there isn't much intelligent life in the river but there are animals.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Harkin Pass
entries: Harkin Pass is a space between the Gray Mountains and the Forlorn Mountains.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: ENTER OCCUPANTS

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Capital of Warberland
entries: The Capital of Warberland is the name given to the capital of the colony Warberland.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Capital of Warberland is very diverse and mainly consists of dragonborns, humans, kobalts, satyrs, halflings, and tieflings.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Freaxir
entries: Freaxir is the wizard school Omurice went to.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Freaxir has similar demographics to {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} with some outliers. This includes dragonborns, humans, halflings, satyrs, tieflings, and kobalts.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Gray Mountains
entries: The Gray Mountains are a stormy mountain range in Warberland.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Gray mountains doesn't house much life on them, but there are many cave creatures inside them and Air genasi above them.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Gray River
entries: The Gray River is a river in Warberland that starts at the base of the Gray mountains.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Around the Gray river there are similar species to {@adventure Warberland|CRDA|1|Warberland} such as dragonborns, humans, halflings, satyrs, tieflings, and kobalts. there isn't much intelligent life in the river but lots of freshwater fish.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Green Wall
entries: The Green Wall is a range of tall grassy hills on the border of Warberland.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: The Green wall doesn't have many creatures living on it. There are a few individuals that may, but generally its just goats.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Golscon
entries: Golscon is the Capital of Tarehas.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Golscon is occupied by manily humans.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Delorno
entries: Delorno is a town in Tarehas that fought back against Selatis.

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Delorno is occupied by mainly humans

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE

entries.name: Tellensa
entries: Tellensa is the Capital of Selatis.

entries.name: Atmosphere
entries: ENTER APPEARENCE
