entries.name: Warberset Grows Angry (1562)
entries: {@adventure Dremin Warberset|Cerdia|5|Dremin Warberset} came into power in {@adventure Bardoran|Cerdia|1|Bardoran} with the goal of forming a united nation of dwarves as opposed to the smaller and separate nations of his time. While he had successful trade agreements with the other nations, these nations did not want to form a union.

Bardoran and its neighbors had trade deals where Bardoran would gain access to the large forges of the nearby nations to process mined goods, and give the owner of the forge a cut of the results. In 1562, Warberset announced plans to build a forge in Bardoran, and the other nations felt betrayed. They began cutting Bardoran out of trade agreements which greatly stunted Bardoran’s previously growing economy. This made Warberset very angry with the neighboring nations.

entries.name: First Contact with Kershak (1565)
entries: While he was aware of the dwarven nations mining above him, {@adventure Kershak|Cerdia|5|Kershak} didn't really care until 1565 when some dwarves entered his volcanic lair. Kershak was angry at the time because he couldn't get the {@adventure Will of Sellarus|Cerdia|4|Will of Sellarus}, so he decided to take his anger out on the small dwarven nation. Before he did, Kershak became aware of Warberset's frustrations and realized Warberset could be manipulated. Through doing this, Kershak could build a force of mortals to search for the will.

entries.name: The Deal (1575)
entries: Kershak called Warberset down to his lair in 1575 where he made a proposition. He explained he needed manpower to search for something, and he would be willing to help Warberset if they made a deal. Kershak would have ultimate control over the nation of Bardoran, and in return Kershak would help Warberset form a united dwarven nation by force. Warberset agreed, and {@adventure the conquest|CRDA|3|The Conquest of the North} began.

entries.name: The Start of Conquest (1576)
entries: Before {@adventure Bardoran|Cerdia|1|Bardoran} took over, it was a much smaller nation of miners like the nations around it. Eventually the miners of each nation began mine in the same areas and conflicts grew over territory. On a few occasions these disputes became violent. The leaders of these nations made an agreement over territory, but resentment remained in the minds of the miners.

Before the conquest Bardoran and its neighbors had trade deals where Bardoran would gain access to the large forges of the nearby nations to process mined goods, and give the owner of the forge a cut of the results. In 1562, Bardoran began construction on its own forge which made the nearby nations feel betrayed. They began cutting Bardoran out of trade agreements which greatly stunted Bardoran’s previously growing economy. This increased tensions further.

In 1575, {@adventure Kerhsak|Cerdia|1|Kerhsak} agreed to provide his services in combat as part of {@adventure |Cerdia|1|Bardoran} with the Bardoran king, {@adventure Dremin Warberset|Cerdia|5|Dremin Warberset}.

entries.name: Throughout the Conquest (1575-1607)
entries: Kershak’s demonic power could easily and quickly defeat the armies of other nations, at which point the Bardoran army would raid the remains of the nations. If the nation was dwarven bardoran would recruit the workers into the army, and kill/imprison those that didn’t. Non-dwarven groups were slaughtered or displaced.

As the conquest went on, the bardoran army itself became a powerful force and Kershak was needed less and less. Eventually Bardoran was able to conquer nations without Kershak’s help. Kershak did provide aid near the end of the conquest to defeat Merazarx.

entries.name: Kershak - Merazarx Battle (1607)
entries: in 1607, Kershak entered the Warberset mountains before the Bardoran troops because he knew that Merazarx would be able to defeat them. By this point the Bardoran army was powerful enough to conquer nations themselves, but Kershak knew Merazarx was very powerful. Merazarx told her followers to prepare for an attack by Bardoran when it first began expanding and she remained ready to fight Kershak head on. As she predicted Kershak and Bardoran arrived, and a battle between the two immortals began. The battle lasted hours and left both nearly dead. Kershak was overall victorious but very weak. Wanting to avoid the will of Merzarx activating, Kershak trapped Merazarx in an enchanted dungeon under Dran’s Deep that would keep her incapacitated and contained.

entries.name: End of the Conquest (1607)
entries: After his battle with Merazarx in 1607, Kershak wanted to take time to regain power. At the same time, the nobles of Bardoran were satisfied with the loot they had acquired. In 1608 the nation Artoz feared for its safety and attacked Bardoran preemptively. Bardoran responded with a massive military attack that easily crushed Artoz. Bardoran pulled most of their troops back into the north and instead had a much smaller military presence to establish a colony which was named Warberland.

entries.name: Fears Rise (1575 - 1580)
entries: In 1575 {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} began its {@adventure The Conquest of the North|CRDA|3|The Conquest of the North} where {@adventure Kerhsak|CRDA|5|Kershak} would attack the military of an area and Bardoran soldiers would enter after to claim the land. By 1580, Bardoran had begun expanding past its previously neighboring nations and wass growing quite fast. This made the students and faculty alike of {@adventure Freaxir|CRDA|1|Freaxir} nervous for their safety. After discussing with {@adventure Elesira Ceydor|CRDA|5|Elesira Ceydor}, {@adventure Armentus|CRDA|5|Armemtus} decided to ensure the protection of Freaxir and herself.

entries.name: The Deal (1580)
entries: Armentus proposed a deal to Kershak that Freaxir would remain protected and able to operate even if the surrounding area is taken over. In return, Bardoran would have compliance by Freaxir if needed, and Kershak would not have to worry about Armentus interfering with his plans. Kershak accepted as he worried his siblings would try to get the will before him.

entries.name: Impacts (1580 - Present)
entries: After the deal had been made, Armentus went into hiding in the deep ocean to avoid Kershak changing his mind. The area Freaxir occupied was eventually taken over, but Kershak made sure Bardoran left it alone.

entries.name: Cain Expresses Concern (1580)
entries: After the first years of Bardoran’s conquest, Cain became increasingly more concerned with his intentions. Cain knew Kershak was greedy and powerful, and he wondered if his brother intended to take over the world. Cain also knew there were many powerful creatures throughout Cerdia that may be able to oppose his brother.

Cain sent a message expressing that Kershak may be overconfident. Kershak was insulted and angry, but he didn’t initially show it. Kershak also suspected that Cain was trying to get him to stop so that he could get the will of Sellarus himself.

entries.name: Kershak Betrays Cain (1580)
entries: Kershak invited Cain and his acolytes to join him in his volcanic lair. Kershak said was going to explain his plans to Cain and that he had an offer for Cain. Cain agreed to meet and brought his acolytes with him. At the time Cain had dozens of acolytes who formed a cult that did Cain’s bidding. Once They arrived at Kershak’s lair, Kershak brought Cain to a separate room as Bardoran troops and Serick blocked the exit and began slaughtering Cain’s acolytes. Kershak brought Cain to a balcony to watch his acolytes being massacred, and decapitated the shocked Cain before he could react.

entries.name: Impacts (1580 - Present)
entries: Cain was enraged by Kershak’s betrayal, and Kershak was somewhat relieved and empowered. Cain was able to survive by escaping into the nonphysical realm, but he still lost his body and all his acolytes. This was one of the reasons Cain was so willing to accept Aurelius as an acolyte, and spent so much time helping her train.

entries.name: First Tensions (1679 - 1713)
entries: Tensions began during the rule of King (George) Aerwyna III when Selatis fishing boats over time grew closer to Tarehas shores. Up to this point Selatis had respected Tarehas’s territory, but no official agreement was ever made. Aerwyna III sent a message to the current Selatis king, (Thomas) Darius II asking to formalize these boundaries in the Tellensa Treaty. The negotiation process was tense, both sides trying to take as much of the sea as possible, but an agreement was made. Both Selatis fishers and Tarehas fishers ignored the agreements, and the tensions grew among the fisherpeople.

entries.name: Capture of the Salthopper (1713)
entries: The Salthopper was a fishing boat of Tarehas citizens that in April of 1713, went into some of the dedicated Selatis waterspace of the Tellensa Treaty. The area was part of a breeding space of tuna, and many Selatis fishers were angry the Salthopper was taking all the fish. The Selatis fishers reported the Salthopper to the Selatis navy, who sent a ship that arrested the Tarehas fishers, and claimed the boat. Tarehas responded by beginging to take control of Selatis fishing boats in their area.

entries.name: Declaration of War (1713)
entries: After Tarehas began capturing Selatis fishing ships, Selatis sent a feel of 12 naval ships to reclaim them. During negotiations, one of the ships was secretly set ablaze by Selatis and blamed on the Tarehas military. Tarehas claimed it was an independent citizen, but Selatis declared war

entries.name: Battle of Golscon (1713)
entries: Upon Decree of war, the Naval ships already at Tarehas moved began firing on the naval ships of Tarehas, before leaving for reinforcements. Tarehas prepared as well as they could, mainly preparing to help the royals escape. The Selatis navy returned with many more ships that easily crushed the Tarehas navy. Once reaching land, the Selatis navy had much more trouble navigating through the unfamiliar land, but they reached the Castle itself within a day with their much greater numbers

entries.name: Escape of the Royals (1713)
entries: Many Selatis naval ships stayed in the water to catch the royal family if they try to escape. Knowing this, each member of the royal family set out in separate, small sailboats, along with many other decoy sailboats being steered by soldiers. The Selatis navy soon caught on to this, and only the prince escaped by going around the west side of the island and eventually reaching Warberland. The King and Queen were imprisoned and brought to Selatis as prisoners

entries.name: Battle of Delorna (1713)
entries: Selatis pulled most of its troops away from Tarehas after the castle was taken. Those that remained began to establish control over the island, claiming it as territory of Selatis. Selatis underestimated the will of many civilians in Tarehas, and many fought back in the small town of Delorno.The Selatis soldiers were pushed back and the townspeople retreated into the forest. The Selatis soldiers asked for more aid from Selatis, but they were told eventually some would come..

entries.name: Stalemate (1713 - Present)
entries: After the Battle of Delorno, the Selatis soldiers remained in the castle while the Tarehas resistance continued to hide and move around in Tarehas. The result is a form of guerilla warfare from the resistance. Soon, the dwindling Selatis forces began to remain in the castle until they can receive more help.

entries.name: Inital Tensions (1540)
entries: In 1540 Tensions grew between the Drow and the town of Craiton (currently Kortain) when Craiton began to do extreme logging. The drow rely on the forest ecology to survive and they surfaced to express this. The Craiton lumberjacks called 30 soldiers to talk to the Drow diplomats. The 10 Drow that came to express the concerns were armed, but they were not wielding their weapons when they came to negotiate. After some arguing, a Craiton guard pushed one of the Drow in anger, and a different Drow pushed the guard back and knocked him over. The guards then drew their swords, followed by the Drow, and a battle broke out

entries.name: The First Battle (1540)
entries: The extremely skilled drow killed all but 5 of the soldier who they left to run away. A few of the Drow had bad cuts, but nothing that was permanent. The Craiton soldiers returned to the town and war was declared.

entries.name: The Destruction of Craiton (1540)
entries: The Craiton soldiers entered the forest Drisk, trying to find the Drow settlement. Anticipating this, The Drow had prepared arms and ambushed the Craitonians. The Drow easily massacred the heavily armored soldiers trying to move throughout the dense forest. Many Craitonians did retreat and the Drow followed. A battle ensued in the Capital of Craiton. The Cratonians were now in more familiar territory, but the drow were much more skilled and coordinated. They were able to reach the house of Lord _ and demanded he take his people north. The city of Craiton was abandoned, and later the land was taken up by Kortain.

entries.name: Impacts (1540 - Present)
entries: The world began to be very wary of the Drow. Since Craiton had a very strong military, it’s fall in battle was shocking. Kortain eventually took over the land that Craiton once ruled over, but remembering it’s downfall, Kortain has not attempted to expand into the forest

entries.name: Taka Disobeys Bardoran (1708)
entries: In 1708, {@adventure Taka|CRDA|5|Taka} and a group of 29 other {@creature Bardoran Conqueror|CRDA|Bardoran conquerors} were ordered to clear an encampment of tieflings. Relocating or killing other groups in an area is a very common thing for conquerors to do in modern {@adventure Bardoran|CRDA|1|Bardoran} and usually the groups try to fight back but are defeated.

In this instance the group of tieflings were ones who had escaped past confrontations and they were unarmed. The conquerors had orders to kill this group since they had been trouble for Bardoran for a while, but when the conquerors arrived they were struck by how defenseless this group was. Taka himself burst into a tent where a father was clutching his baby and begging for the child's life, saying he doesn't care if he dies.

25 soldiers total decided to not attack the camp. The remaining soldiers were held back by the others, and retreated to the nearest dwarven settlement. The disobeying group, realizing they would be in great trouble, ran away from the camp.

entries.name: Ugla Gains Power(1708)
entries: A {@creature Bardoran Scout|CRDA|Bardoran scout} reported to {@adventure Ugla|CRDA|5|Ugla} that her son had abandoned his duty and that she should report if he comes back home. Taka eventually did go to his mother and told her what happened. He then explained that the group of deserters planned to go to the capital with the Tieflings to show the workers how heartless Bardoran is to spark a rebellion.

Ugla saw an opportunity to rise the social ladder, and reported to an officer she had information about an upcoming coup, but that she wanted to talk to a higher official. She was brought to a higher level official and continued to do this until she was talking to {@adventure King Dremin Warberset|CRDA|5|Dremin Warberset}.

Ugla told Warberset about the coup and said she would get more information about it for a price. Warberset liked her and agreed to give her a high position in the castle. Ugla talked to her son about the details of the coup and reported them back as promised.

Warberset was attracted to Ugla and he made her his concubine fulfilling his promise to give her a high position in the castle. Though not what she had in mind, Ugla saw she had influence over the king and felt she could become even more powerful.

entries.name: Taka is Killed(1708)
entries: To not raise suspicion dragonborn mercenaries were secretly hired to kill the deserters before they could do anything. The mercenaries were told they were killing Bardoran conquerors who were ordered to kill a camp of innocent tieflings, so the mercenaries were very eager to not only get paid, but also stop Bardoran from doing a terrible thing. Bardoran made sure to have many workers moving through area when the deserters were killed, so the story of dragonborns ambushing a group of conquerors spread very quickly

entries.name: The Curse (1708)
entries: In 1708 {@adventure Sierra Aerwyna|CRDA|5|Sierra Aerwyna} (at the time called Sierra forehtoak) was romantically pursued by {@adventure Salodar|CRDA|5|Salodar}. Aerwyna did not accept these advances and Salodar became angry. With her knowing, He cursed her firstborn because he knew she wanted to be a mother.

entries.name: Aleric Aerwyna is born ()
entries: When Sierra became pregnant with {@adventure Aleric Aerwyna|CRDA|5|Aleric Aerwyna}, she warned {@adventure Daniel Aerwyna|CRDA|5|Daniel Aerwyna} and {@adventure Ceilean Aerwyna|CRDA|5|Ceilean Aerwyna} of the curse. Daniel asked Ceilean to try to find some cure, and Ceilean eagerly began searching. While traveling, Ceilean remembered {@adventure Nakiscine|CRDA|5|Nakiscine} and used her crystal ball to make contact.

entries.name: The Trick ()
entries: Nakiscine saw an opportunity to gain power. Nakiscine created a ritual to give herself youth and magical power using the heart of a drow. The drow has to be an adult and must have not gone through the {@adventure Verathon|CRDA|1|Verathon} ceremony, where {@adventure Freiseln|CRDA|5|Freiseln} gives some of her venom to them. Finding a drow that fits these restrictions had been impossible but Nakiscine realised she can use Ceilean Aerwyna to get such a drow. Freiseln would have sensed Nakiscine trying to steal a drow child, but not the less powerful Ceilean Aerwyna.

Nakiscine told Aerwyna that she can use the blood of a healthy drow with relatively the same physical maturity to continuously heal Alric Aerwyna. Nakiscine agreed to make an elixir that would use the blood to help Alric, as well as an elixir that makes the drow appear and age like a human.
Nakiscine in reality planned to use some of the blood for herself, and when the time is right, harvest the heart of the drow

entries.name: Stealing the Drow ()
entries: Ceilean Aerwyna hired 5 mercenaries to help her steal the drow child. When in the caves under the {@adventure Forest Drisk|CRDA|2|Forest Drisk}, the mercenaries were surrounded by the drow, while Aerwyna, who was not traveling directly with them, snuck into Verathon and stole a drow infant. By the time the drow got the mercenaries to leave, Aerwyna had escaped undetected.

entries.name: The Potions ()
entries: When Ceilean Aerwyna returned with the infant, Alric Aerwyna had been born but was very sick. Nakiscine quickly made a potion that temporarily healed the Alric, saving his life. Nakiscine brought {@adventure her house|CRDA|2|Nakiscine's House} into the mountains of {@adventure Tarehas|CRDA|1|Tarehas} so she could continue to make the potions. Ceilean named the child Aurelius and raised her as her own child, using a potion made by Nakiscine to make Aurelius age and appear like a human. In doing this, Aurelius was kept healthy and around the same physical maturity of Alric so the blood could be used to heal him. Every month, Ceilean would extract blood using an enchanted needle that could not be felt by Aurelius throughout her sleep. This needle would also heal the small wound it left.

Ceilean did not tell the whole story to Daniel and Sierra. She said that there was a powerful magic user who was making the potion for Alric, but did not mention anything about the drow or who the magic user was. She said that the child she was taking care of was the daughter of a friend who she met on her travels. Daniel and Sierra, meanwhile, did not tell Alirc about the curse and snuck the potion into his food.

entries.name: Kershak
entries: Kershak is the demon that helped Bardoran take over the north. He is the demon of greed and power hunger. Kershak is the eldest child of Sellarus and Habeshca and the brother of Cain and Armentus.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Evil

rows.name: Bonds
items: {@adventure Sellarus|CRDA|5|Sellarus}. Kershak's father, who he hates
{@adventure Hebeshca|CRDA|5|Hebeshca}. Kershak's mother, who he fears
{@adventure Serick|CRDA|5|Serick}. The only mortal Kershak likes
{@adventure Dremin Warberset|CRDA|5|Dremin Warberset}. Kershak can easily manipulate to control the forces of Bardoran

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Kershak has dark, hard skin and long but muscular arms and legs. He has sharp gray horns/ spikes that protrude from his shoulders, knees, elbows, spine, cheek bones, temples, and forehead. He has no feet, instead he has a single spike-like claw that protrudes underneath each of his calves. His hands are bony with sharp claws. His face is gaunt, with his sharp teeth always bared and his nose like that of a skull. He has four, glowing yellow, reptilian eyes on the front of his face, and one on the back of his head.

Kershak wears dark metal armor. This armor includes a breastplate with no sleeves or shoulder guards, and an opening on the back to allow his spikes to poke through. He has additional plating on his legs that have a hole cut for the spikes on his knees. Underneath this plating he has dark chainmail

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: Innumerable Years Old (BCE - Present)

entries.name: Early Family Relations (BCE)
items: Kershak felt Sellarus didn’t use his power to his full extent and that his father cared too much about mortals. Kershak also felt Sellarus didn’t appreciate his power enough.

Kershak initially saw his mother as weak compared to him and Sellarus, but as time went on he realized she was extremely powerful and extremely good at hiding it. This made him afraid of her and whatever she may be plotting.

Kershak saw his siblings as weak compared to him and didn’t really care about them if they didn’t interfere with his plans. For this reason Kershak felt even more disdain towards Sellarus because he felt his father should cherish him the most.

entries.name: The Will of Sellarus (1323)
items: The will of Sellarus made Kershak extremely mad. Since he was the eldest of Sellarus, Kershak assumed he would get Sellarus’s power if he dies, so when Sellarus made the possibility that any demon could get his power, Kershak was enraged.
Intally Kershak was unaware of the third key but once he learned that Hebeshca had made it and helped hide the will, he also grew resentment towards his mother.

entries.name: The Warberset-Kershak Deal (1575)
items: Wanting nothing more than more power, Kershak realised that he would need power and help to scour Cerdia for the keys and the will itself. When Bardoran began mining close to his volcanic lair, Kershak was initially annoyed but then saw that he could take advantage of the king, Dremin Warberset. Since Warberset was already mad at neighboring kingdoms, Kershak easily fueled his rage and convinced him to make the {@adventure The Warberset-Kershak Deal|CRDA|3|The Warberset-Kershak Deal}.

entries.name: The Conquest (1575 - 1608)
items: Kershak reveled in the fear that mortals had when they first saw him. For Kershak, the conquest was generally enjoyable. He also began to enjoy having an army of minions that would do his bidding.

Soon after the conquest began, Armentus sent a message to Kershak requesting the Armentus - Kershak Deal. Kershak didn’t know much about Freaxir but didn’t see it as a threat, and he didn’t have any plans of expanding south of  what is now the Bardoran river. He agreed, feeling relieved he had one less thing to worry about interfering.

When Cain became worried of Kershak’s greed, he sent a message in 1580 to Kershak warning him that other entities would try to stop him. Kershak saw this message as both an insult and a threat, and decided to remove Cain from the physical plane and kill his acolytes. Kershak invited Cain to discuss and brought him into his lair, where Cain was shown his acolytes being murdered before Kershak decapitated him from behind.

When Kershak reached Merazarx’s territory in 1607, he knew she would put up a fight, but his recent successes against other powerful beings made him feel confident. The battle left Kershak successful but very weak and injured, and he angrily retreated to his volcanic layer. Realising he should avoid killing Merazarx because of her will, he instead used his power to create an enchanted cage under Dran’s Deep that would keep her unconscious and contained.
After his battle with Merazarx, Kershak was frustrated and wanted to ensure control of the territory Bardoran had acquired. He requested Warberset end the conquest

entries.name: Cain
entries: Cain is the demon of mental turmoil and the patron of Aurelius. He is the middle child of Sellarus and Hebeshca, and the brother of Armentus and Kershak.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Good

rows.name: Bonds
items: {@adventure Hebeshca|CRDA|5|Hebeshca}. Cain's mother, who he admires
{@adventure KershakCRDA|5|Kerhsak}. Cain's brother, who he hates

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Cain’s head is a deer skull and his lower half is a deer’s body. His neck and torso are dark blue skin with some dark blue scales. He has no hands, but instead has a dark blue crocodile head coming from both of his elbows. He has six yellow, reptilian eyes, with three on each of his antlers, and there are no eyes in the sockets of his skull or crocodile heads. He wears no clothes.

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: Innumerable Years Old (BCE - Present)

entries.name: Early Family Relations (BCE)
items: Cain liked Sellarus and followed his example of communicating with mortals. He also inherited his mother’s talent to manipulate mortals and demons alike, and admired her
Cain found both of his siblings annoying in different ways. Cain saw Kershak as egotistical and Armentus as a small nuisance that was always focused on some project he saw as unimportant.

entries.name: Children of Cain (1212)
items: Cain began to collect followers who devoted themselves to having minds of strong will and seeking truth. Cain being the demon of metal turmoil, many saw him as very knowledgeable, and in many areas he was. Those who were most devoted became Cain’s acolytes and would do Cain’s bidding, which usually involved collecting information. The group named themselves the Children of Cain

entries.name: The Will of Sellarus (1323)
items: Cain was largely uninterested in the Will of Sellarus until he began to think about what would happen if Kershak got it. He began secretly making his acolytes search for the box, and knowing Hebeshca was involved he knew it would be hard to find. It was because of these efforts Cain learned about the Writ of Hebeshca.

entries.name: The Betrayal of Cain (1580)
items: In 1580, Cain took notice of Kershak’s conquest of the north and began to fear what Kershak was planning. Hoping to calm Kershak down, Cain sent a message saying to Kershak saying that he was going down a dangerous path and he should not overestimate his power. Kershak took this as an insult and invited Cain and his acolytes to join him to discuss a proposition. Cain was intrigued, and he obeyed without suspicion. When he got there, Kershak took him away from his acolytes and then brought him to a balcony where he watched the Children of Cain getting massacred. Before he could react, Cain was beheaded by Kershak. Cain’s spirit escaped to the non-physical plain, but his body and acolytes were destroyed. This made Cain angry at both Kershak for betraying him, and himself for being so foolish

entries.name: Pact With Aurelius (1713)
items: In 1713, Cain for the first time in a while heard someone praying to his name. The person was Aurelius Aerwyna, who, feeling betrayed by her aunt and was under stress from an imminent raid by Selatis, was looking for knowledge and power. Cain, desperate and interested in her story and potential, made her his first acolyte in over a hundred years.

entries.name: Armentus
entries: Armentus is the demon of obsession and perfectionism who is calling Krabmann and teleported Omurice. Armentus is the youngest child of Sellarus and Hebeshca, and the sister of Cain and Kershak

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Good

rows.name: Bonds
items: {@adventure Hebeshca|CRDA|5|Hebeshca}. Armentus's mother, who she loves
{@adventure Kerhsak|CRDA|5|Kerhsak}. Armentus's brother, who she dislikes
{@adventure Freaxir|CRDA|1|Freaxir}. The school created by Armentus

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Armentus has glistening light blue skin that glows at times and pupiless eyes. She has three arms, one on each side of her torso and one protruding from her chest, that all have four, thumb-like fingers. She has no hair, but several somewhat transparent white fins coming from the sides, back and top of her head. She has no legs, her bottom half resembles a jellyfish. She wears no clothes

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: Innumerable Years Old (BCE - Present)

entries.name: Early Family Relations (BCE)
items: Armentus was pretty neutral to Sellarus but had a great bond with Hebeshca. She learned her mother’s art of making things remain hidden, and aspired to be like her.
Armentus had ok relations with Cain, but she knew he didn’t value any of her projects and was often annoyed with her. Armentus disliked Kershak, who she saw as egotistical.

entries.name: Freaxir (1320 - Present)
items: In 1320 Armentus decided she wanted followers like other demons and she wanted them to be very knowledgeable about the arcane. She made contact with the similarly valued Elesira Ceydor who was open to the idea and collected others who sought to build a hub of knowledge. By selling enchanted objects and spells, the group was able to collect funds to build the school and house many magical books and items. Throughout this process, Armentus became more interested in creating the best institution to learn magic rather than followers. Throughout this process Armentus also became very close with Ceydor, who she made an actual acolyte.

When Kershak began conquering the north, Ceydor expressed her own and her student’s fears of invasion. Armentus agreed, and made a deal with Kershak in 1580 ensuring Freaxir would be protected if Bardoran took the area over. When Bardoran eventually did, Freaxir was ordered to be undisturbed in return for cooperation. After making this deal with Kershak, Armentus went into hiding in the deep chasms of the ocean using the techniques she learned from her mother knowing that he might vilify her at some point

entries.name: The Will of Sellarus(1323)
items: When Sellarus made the will, Armentus initially thought it was hilarious as she knew Kershak would be enraged. She then tasked her followers with collecting info on the will. It was through this tactic that she learned about the Writ of Hebeshca.

entries.name: Armentus Chosen (1713)
items: Hidden in the ocean, Armentus observed many creatures including water genasi. At this time, Armentus wanted to find individuals who could help her without alerting Kershak. She saw Krabmann as a strong willed individual with much promise. Having a soft spot for the underdog she fixated on him and decided he would be a good candidate. Knowing the location of the Writ of Hebeshca, She mysteriously called Krabmann to remain hidden but still accomplish her task

At the same time, Ceydor was on the lookout for talented magic users to help Armentus on her search. Ceydor took note of Omurice who, from Vice Chancellor Berids’s complaints, She learned had great potential. Ceydor expressed Omurice’s professors’ testimony of his promise, and Omurice’s ambition to Armentus was interested in him.

When Armentus called Krabmann to the Writ of Hebeshca, she suddenly realized how naive he was and decided he needed help before entering such a drastically new environment. She decided to teleport Omurice to his location, and luckily they seemed to get along.

entries.name: Dremin Warberset
entries: Dremin Warberset is the King of Bardoran

entries.name: Personality
entries: Lawful Evil

rows.name: Bonds
items: {@adventure Kershak|CRDA|5|Kerhsak}. Warberset made a deal with him

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Dremin Warberset is stout and has orangish hair and a beard. He has brown eyes and light tan skin. He often is wearing a crown and an intricate cape to signify his royalty. He wears heavy plate armor decorated with gold to signify his strength and riches.

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: 218 Years Old (1495 - Present)

entries.name: Early Life (1495 - 1526)
items: Dremin Warberset was born when Bardoran was a much smaller kingdom. He, like most Bardonians at the time, was born into a mining family. Warberset had dreams of becoming a leader, and wanted to unite the nearby nations under one flag. At the time, Warberset imagined this union to form through treaties and economic trade.

entries.name: Rise to Power (1526 - 1545)
items: hen he was 31, Warberset made a deal with a forge in a nearby kingdom where he would get 30 pickaxes and they would get some mined resources. Those who Warberset gave the new pickaxes easily made back what was lost, and made good profits for Bardoran. This made him a sort of local hero amongst a few families.

Barus Torid, the king at the time, took notice to this negotiation, and began making similar negotiations on a larger scale. Barus also took a liking to Warberset, who he asked to meet. Torid found Warberset's spirit inspiring, and made him an advisor.
In 1545, Barus Torid decided to step down, and wanting to give Bardoran a positive future he gave his crown to Warberset.

entries.name: First Years as King (1545 - 1562)
items: Once he became king, Warberset continued the economic agreements with surrounding nations. During these years, the citizens of Bardoran thought Warberset was an inspiring king that may actually secure better lives for the citizens of Bardoran. The nearby nations found the young king to be overly ambitious. Whenever he brought up the topic of a union, the other nations were unwilling, but they still wanted to continue economic agreements.

entries.name: Growing Conflict (1562 - 1576)
items: In 1562, Warberset began the construction of a forge for Bardoran. The people of Bardoran saw this as a great step forward and supported this decision. The surrounding nations however felt somewhat betrayed as Bardoran previously had been making trade agreements to use their forges. As a result the nearby nations decreased trade with Bardoran and increased with eachother. This stunted Bardoran's growth and made Warberset angery

Around this time, Warberset had also been negotiating borders for each kingdom to avoid territory conflict between the miners. Once again, Warberset brought up the option of a union, but was rejected. Following the announcement of the Bardoran forge, the nearby nations made an agreement to share mining territory. This union that Bardoran was cut out of enraged Warberset. And he began resenting the bordering nations.

entries.name: The Start of Conquest (1576)
items: In 1576, Kershak emerged from the volcanic mines of Bardoran and made a deal with Warberset. Warberset saw the deal as not only a way to achive his goal of forming a great dwarven kingdom, but also a form of revenge on the nearby nations.

Warberset had an easy time convincing most of his subjects to go to war, as territory conflicts between them and the other nations had resulted in small brawls already. With the introduction of a demon to the army, those who had doubts about Bardoran’s success were quickly reassured.
Warberset declared war in 1576 under the reasoning of economic betrayal and failure to uphold border agreements

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
items: After the bordering nations had been conquered, Warberset and Bardoran as a whole felt invigorated, and wanted to follow through with Warberset’s dreams of creating a great nation. Kershak had a great role in convincing Warberset to "see [his] vision through".

During the first battles Warberset actually participated in the conquering of the nations bordering Bardoran. As time went on, Warberset directed the war from his increasingly more comfortable fortress

Following his battle with Merazarx in 1607, Kershak convinced Warberset to stop expanding. Warberset grew tired of the war at this point anyways, and wanted to admire and enjoy the benefits of his empire. When Artoz attacked in 1608, Warberset sent an immense number of troops with the goal of ending the battle as quickly as possible. Once they had, Warberset pulled most of his troops back to Bardoran and began to expand control on Warberland much more passivley

entries.name: Gratin Harkin
entries: Grantin Harkin is a noble of Bardoran who owns the Grand Harkin Forge. He is the namesake of the Harkin pass and the creator of the Bardoran berserkers

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic neutral

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Grantin Harkin is muscular and somewhat tall for a dwarf. He has brown eyes, long black hair and a beard he keeps in braids. He often does not wear a shirt, instead he occasionally wears a fur cloak but likes to show his strength. His pants and boots are high quality and thick, with metal plating that has golden trim. He  has tattoos on both arms and back of dwarven patterns and the words(in dwarvish) Honnor, Strength, Bravery. He sometimes wears a helmate that covers his face and has metal horns like that of a bull

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: 232 Years Old (1481 - Present)

entries.name: Early Life (1481 - 1576)
entries: Harkin was born into a somewhat poor family in pre-conquest Bardoran. As Bardoran and its neighboring kingdoms expanded, tensions rose between the miners of each kingdom. Harkin had multiple encounters with the other miners, and was in one of the few interactions that resulted in a small brawl. He was very cutthroat during this brawl and single handedly left five dwarves wounded.

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
entries: Once the conquest started, Harkin was one of the first to rush in (after Kershak). He organized a group of similarly violent dwarves that would all rush in with him with little regard for their own safety. This tactic proved to be very effective to scare and confuse enemies. Dremin Warberset took notice and made him a general and the berserker an official type of soldier of the Bardoran military.
In one of the first battles of the conquest, Harkin and his berserkers chased their enemies throughout that kingdom’s forge. Warberset gave ownership to the new general as a result

During one of the raids led by Harkin, he pushed his enemies south until they attempted to escape through the pass between the Gray Mountains and the Forlorn Mountains. Gratin himself chased them with berserker companions, and caught up with them. Gratin wrote to Dremin, suggesting the pass may be used for economic trade. Dremin agreed, and named the pass after Harkin.

entries.name: Benest Trask
entries: Grantin Harkin is a noble of Bardoran who owns the Grand Harkin Forge. He is the namesake of the Harkin pass and the creator of the Bardoran berserkers

entries.name: Personality
entries: Lawful Evil

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Benest Trask is muscular and athletic. He has blue eyes, long orange hair and a beard he keeps in braids. He often wears heavy plate armor with gold trim to show his strength and power. Usually he won’t wear his helmet, but he does at times.

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: 217 Years Old (1496 - Present)

entries.name: Early Life (1496 - 1545)
items: Trask was born into a family of miners in pre-conquest Bardoran. He grew up a friend of Dremin Warberset, and was one of those who got a new pickaxe when Warberset negotiated for them. Trask supported Warberset when he became an advisor to Barus Torid. When Warberset took power, he made Trask an advisor.

entries.name: Advising The King (1545 - 1576)
items: As Warberset’s advisor, Trask evaluated the needs of the miners and reported them. Since he was originally a miner, Trask got along with the miners and was able to get good insight on their lives.

As time went on the miners of Bardoran and the miners of nearby nations began to mine in the same areas, resulting in disputes between the groups. Trask was very aware of the rising tensions and he grew angry at the nearby nations. After some violent interactions between the groups, Trask encouraged Warberset to take military control of the area, but Warberset didn’t believe Bardoran had the military strength. While Trask agreed, He was still quite mad.

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
items: Once the conquest began, Trask eagerly led the Bardoran troops into battle (after Kershak). Trask continued to lead troops into battle throughout the conquest, so Warberset naturally made him a general.

Trask played a great role in convincing the dwarves of other nations to join the Bardoran army. He would contrast their lives as poor miners to what it could be if they were part of a grand empire. Since his experience with miners made his offer very attractive to the other dwarves.
Kershak influenced Trask to continue pushing east, and for Trask it became a sort of game and a boost to his ego at every new victory.

From 1604 - 1606 Trask successfully led his troops through what is now called the Trask mountains, attacking and displacing those who dwell in them. The area had not been inhibited by dwarves and not much mining had been done there. Trask communicated the opportunity for industry in the area, and Warberset gave him the resources and manpower to build a new forge. The forge and the mountain range was then named after Trask by Warberset.

entries.name: Romil Torid
entries: Romil Torid is a noble of Bardoran who specializes in economic trade and growth. The namesake of the Torid Grand Forge

entries.name: Personality
entries: Lawful evil

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Romil Torrid has graying, black hair that is long and tied into braids with golden and jeweled clasps. He has blue eyes, and round, golden glasses. He wears many rings with jewels, and fine silk clothes with intricate, gold dwarven patterns. He tends to wear red and black in reference to Bardoran

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: 283 Years Old (1430 - Present)

entries.name: Early Life (1430 - 1545)
items: Romil Torrid is the son of Barus Torid, and was part of the upper class of early Bardoran once. Dremin Warberset became an advisor or Barus, Romil and Dremin became friends. Watching the stress his father was always under, Romil didn’t want to become king. Romil suggested Warberset become king when Barus was thinking of stepping down. Dremin made Romil one of his advisors once he took power.

entries.name: Advising The King (1545 - 1576)
items: As an advisor to Warberset, Torid proved to be very gifted in the field of economics. He was very particular about keeping records of purchases, production, and sales. Likewise he was great at utilizing economic patterns to sell and purchase at the best times. Torid worked with Warberset to create beneficial and tempting trade agreements for all parties

After a series of very profitable years for Bardoran, Warberset suggested Bardoran construct a forge. Torid went to work evaluating costs and found that the introduction of a forge in Bardoran would be a great benefit for the nation and increase the economic growth of the entire region.

When Warberset announced the plans for a forge to the nation, the neighboring nations saw a threat as they had previously been making trade agreements to allow Bardoran use their forges. These nations reacted by reducing trade with Bardoran and trading amongst each other. This stunted Bardoran’s economic growth which in turn prevented the forge from being built. Torid was furious.

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
items: When the conquest began, Torid remained in Bardoran to calculate the costs and profits of the war. His rage towards the neighboring nations made the gained resources all the more sweeter

After the conquest of the first kingdoms Bardoran was able to acquire its forge. Warbreset put Torid in charge of the forge for the production of military equipment. Torid not only exceeded the needed production, but also expanded the forge itself. Warberset responded by renaming the forge after Torid.

During the conquest Torid received many benefits from Warberset for his contributions to the war. Torid began to lose touch with the working class and instead became obsessed with efficiency and profits. The most efficient way he found for running the forge was with an iron fist. Kershak sometimes talked to Torid and played a large role in influencing Torid's values

entries.name: Serick
entries: Serick is an undead warlock who serves Kershak.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Evil

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Serick is very gaunt, with gray skin and a dark eye that has a yellow pupil. He Has long black hair, and thin teeth. He has dark spikes that fully pierce through different parts of his body, including on one of his eyes. The ends of his fingers become these dark spikes as well, forming claws. He wears no shoes, and rugged gray pants and a similar rugged gray vest with no shirt underneath.

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: 335 Years Old (1378 - Present)

entries.name: Early Life (1378 - 1399)
items: Serick was born into a poor family in what is now Kortain as Steven Cromil. Growing up his father was a shepard and his family was always on the move following the sheep. He never had a permanent place of residence, and he never had many strong relationships as a result. He instead looked up to his parents, but was very aware that he had a much worse life than others. While he often had little to eat or wear as he traveled, He passed the comfortable mansions of others who treated him as trash, and he felt that way too.

As he aged, Serick grew full of hatred. He could handle his poor life, but as his parents aged he saw they could not. When he was 15 Serick’s mother was raped by a wealthy landowner, and Serick responded by killinging him in the middle of the night. Serick was quickly put in prison and he spent 6 years there. When he got out. His parents had sold most of the sheep because of hard times, and now were even poorer.

entries.name: Becoming Serick (1399 - 1409)
items: Serick’s parents began to become unable to tend to the few sheep remaining because of sickness, so Serick began to steal. He was quite good at stealing, and was never caught in the act. In 1409 he stole from a group of bandits who tracked him down and killed his parents in front of him, and beat him, leaving him to die.

With his last breath, Serick said he would kill all of the bandits and began praying (to nothing in particular) asking for revenge. Kershak answered his prayer and held Serick in a state just after death as he asked for Serick’s story.
Kershak was quite happy with the hatred he saw in the man. Kershak revived him, made Serick his acolyte, and gave him his new name.

entries.name: Descent into Madness (1409 - Present)
items: Serick made true to his promise and killed all of the bandits. His newfound power was intoxicating and he began to lose any sense of empathy he once had. He began to only remember all the pain he felt throughout his life, and wanted to inflict it back onto the world.
Serick eargerly did Kershak's bidding as it often involved causing pain onto others. He reveled in the fear people had when they saw him

entries.name: Mored Tongait
entries: Bardoran Commander/Enforcer

entries.name: Personality
entries: Lawful Evil

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Mored Tongait wears armor similar to that of a Bardoran enforcer, but with gold trim on the edges. He has blue eyes, thought one is covered in an eyepatch with the Bardoran flag on it, and orange hair. He has a beard he keeps in several braids

entries.name: Fairbeak
entries: Fairbeak is a poet in Songbird's tribe, and Songbird's Cousin

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Neutral

rows.name: Ideals
items: The rich can do without a few extra dollars

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Fairbeak wears a simple white dress with a dark blue hooded cape.

entries.name: Vernacis
entries: Vernacis is an orc wizard who has the first key of Sellarus

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Evil

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Vernacis Wears a dark hooded cloak with green trim and dark clothes underneath. He wears a dark metal mask that goes over the top half of his face and covers either side of his mouth. The mask has green runes engraved and painted on it, and two angled slits for his eyes that give him a permanent scowl. He wears dark mental gloves and boots as well that are similarly engraved. He has green eyes and is bald. He looks about middle aged.

entries.name: Early Life (1286 - 1302)
items: Vernacis was born Rhojok Srag in a clan of abouth 300 orcs in the {@adventure Forlorn Mountains|CRDA|2|Forlorn Mountains}. Until he was 16 Vernacis was a hunter-gatherer like the rest of his clan.

entries.name: Becoming a Wizard (1302 - 1318)
items: At the age of 16 Vernacis left the clan to seek other opportunities. During his travels he met a knowledgeable wizard looking for an apprentice. Vernacis was quite good at wizardry but because of his race he was not thought to be very intelligent or capable.

Vernacis wanted to continue progressing but his teacher would not allow him to have the more advanced books. In anger one night of 1304 , Vernacis used thunder wave against his Master, killing him. He stole the books and ran off.
after this event, Vernacis continued to study the books and killng other wizards he came across for their books. in 1318 he returned to his clan after being wanted in many places.

entries.name: The Disciples of Vernacis (1319)
items: In 1319 a division grew between the orc clan Vernacis was a part of. Many orcs began leaving in search of better opportunities. On some occasions these orcs would return and tell the others of the growing world outside of the Forlorn Mountains. This caused a division between those in the clan who wanted to stay in the mountains and those who wanted the clan to go out of the mountains.

Vernacis was a part of the side that wanted to stay. His bad experiences had tainted the rest of Cerdia for him, and he argued against leaving the familiar Forlorn Mountains despite what better lives may be outside of them. Vernacis became a leader of those who wanted to stay. Eventually the clan split, and Vernacis was made leader of the new clan. This was the beginning of the {@adventure Disciples of Vernacis|CRDA|1|Disciples of Vernacis}.

entries.name: Growing Power (1319 - 1713)
items: As Vernacis became more powerful from the books and items he had stolen, He became more confident and power hungry. He began traveling again in search of more power. He was successful and began haording all forms of books and magical items. One of these items was {@adventure The First Key of Sellarus|CRDA|3|The First Key of Sellarus}.

During this search for power, Vernacis became obsessed with becoming imortal. He had collected many books and began using many different methods to deage himself. He was successful in keeping himself at the age of 40 for hundreds of years.

In 1421 Vernacis and {@adventure Elesira Ceydor|CRDA|5|Elesira Ceydor} encountered eachother while trying to obtain the same book. They fought and Vernacis succeeded in getting the book after seriously injuring Ceydor. Vernacis was also injured, however, and he began to travel less affterwards.

entries.name: Meeting Rafod Srag (1713)
items: In 1713, Vernacis’s disciples captured {@adventure Rafod Sarg|CRDA|5|Rafod Sarg} who explained he was a relative of Vernacis and had come to lead wizardry from Vernacis. Sarg was Vernacis’s  great great nephew, and Vernacis was very excited to have an apprentice, so Sarg was accepted.

entries.name: Death (1713)
items: Three months after being accepted, Vernacis caught Srag trying to escape. Vernacis was mad and hurt Srag would try to do this. In his anger Vernacis fired a firebolt at Srag who dodged it and fired back. Vernacis deflected the bolt but accidentally sent it into a jar with a spell that exploded and killed Vernacis.

entries.name: Rafod Srag
entries: Rafod Srag is an aspiring orc wizard, and the nephew of Vernacis

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Good

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Rafod Srag wears very plain brown clothes with a leather vest and leather boots. He has green eyes, and his orcish tusks are relatively small. He keeps his black hair pulled back into a braid

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: 17 Years Old (1696 - Present)

entries.name: Running away (1712-1713)
items: In 1712, Rafod Srag ran away from his home because he didn’t want to be a sheep farmer all his life. He went to Thrun initially but was unable to find work with his limited skills. He remembered hearing about his Great Great Uncle (Vernacis) being a great wizard who lived in the Forlorn Mountains. Srag thought he could learn magic under his relative and went into the mountains.

entries.name: Living with Vernacis (1713)
items: Once arriving in the mountains, Srag was captured by the disciples of Vernacis. Srag claimed he was a relative of Vernacis who was trying to learn wizardry, so the warriors brought him to the dungeon of Castle Vernacis. Vernacis questioned Srag and did a blood test, and found Srag was in fact his relative.

Vernacis made Srag his apprentice and Srag began to learn magic. He was quite good at it and enjoyed doing magic, but he came to realize Vernacis was extremely cruel. Vernacis would boast about terrible things he has done and was easily angered.

entries.name: Killing Vernacis (1713)
items: In 1713, about three months after Srag had arrived, an innocent traveler was captured and incinerated by Vernacis in front of Srag. Thoroughly traumatized and morally uneasy, Srag atttemped to escape from Castle Vernacis by climbing a rope down from the window of his room. Before he could begin climbing, Vernacis caught him and was enraged. Vernacis fired a fire bolt at Srag who dodged and fired back. Srag’s bolt was also deflected but it hit a jar with a spell that exploded, killing Vernacis. Some disciples rushed into the room where Srag quickly used disguise self to pretend to be Vernacis. Srag (as Vernacis) convinced them that the he was just doing an experiment and everything was fine.

Following killing Vernacis, Srag realized that the disciples would hunt him down if they found out. To have time to make a plan, Srag continued to use disguise self to make it appear that Vernacis was still alive. Unable to think of a plan, Srag has been doing this for three weeks.

entries.name: Atheria
entries: Atheria is the elf godess who created Elestir

entries.name: Personality
entries: Lawful Neutral

rows.name: Ideals
items: A perfect life is a quiet life

entries.name: Appearance
entries: DESCRIPTION

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: Innumerable Years Old (BCE - Present)

entries.name: Freiseln
entries: Freieln is the Drow godess who created Verathon

entries.name: Personality
entries: Chaotic Good

entries.name: Appearance
entries: DESCRIPTION

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: AGE Years Old (START - END)

entries.name: PERIOD(START - END)
items: Serick was born into a poor family in what is now Kortain as Steven Cromil. Growing up his father was a shepard and his family was always on the move following the sheep. He never had a permanent place of residence, and he never had many strong relationships as a result. He instead looked up to his parents, but was very aware that he had a much worse life than others. While he often had little to eat or wear as he traveled, He passed the comfortable mansions of others who treated him as trash, and he felt that way too.

entries.name: Welm
entries: Welm collects water in caves underground to brew mead

entries.name: Personality
entries: Lawful Good

entries.name: Appearance
entries: DESCRIPTION

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: AGE Years Old (START - END)

items: Serick was born into a poor family in what is now Kortain as Steven Cromil. Growing up his father was a shepard and his family was always on the move following the sheep. He never had a permanent place of residence, and he never had many strong relationships as a result. He instead looked up to his parents, but was very aware that he had a much worse life than others. entries: Prell brews mead in the caves under Selatis

entries.name: Personality
entries: Lawful Neutral

rows.name: Ideals
items: Quality of company is better than quantity of company

entries: DESCRIPTION

entries.name: Lifetime
entries: AGE Years Old (START - END)

entries.name: PERIOD(START - END)
items: Serick was born into a poor family in what is now Kortain as Steven Cromil. Growing up his father was a shepard and his family was always on the move following the sheep. He never had a permanent place of residence, and he never had many strong relationships as a result. He instead looked up to his parents, but was very aware that he had a much worse life than others. While he often had little to eat or wear as he traveled, He passed the comfortable mansions of others who treated him as trash, and he felt that way too.
